MIDNIGHT RULES RELIEF ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 2

congVote.result: So the motion to recommit was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 21, to amend chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, and to provide for en bloc consideration in resolutions of disapproval for ``midnight rules'', by a recorded vote of 238 ayes to 184 noes, Roll No. 8.<P/>Rejected the Castor (FL) motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on the Judiciary with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 183 yeas to 236 nays, Roll No. 7.

The House passed H.R. 21, to amend chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, and to provide for en bloc consideration in resolutions of disapproval for ``midnight rules'', by a recorded vote of 238 ayes to 184 noes, Roll No. 8.<P/>Rejected the Castor (FL) motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on the Judiciary with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 183 yeas to 236 nays, Roll No. 7.

The House passed H.R. 21, to amend chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, and to provide for en bloc consideration in resolutions of disapproval for ``midnight rules'', by a recorded vote of 238 ayes to 184 noes, Roll No. 8.

The House passed H.R. 21, to amend chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, and to provide for en bloc consideration in resolutions of disapproval for ``midnight rules'', by a recorded vote of 238 ayes to 184 noes, Roll No. 8.

The House passed H.R. 21, to amend chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, and to provide for en bloc consideration in resolutions of disapproval for ``midnight rules'', by a recorded vote of 238 ayes to 184 noes, Roll No. 8.<P/>Rejected the Castor (FL) motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on the Judiciary with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 183 yeas to 236 nays, Roll No. 7.

The House passed H.R. 21, to amend chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, and to provide for en bloc consideration in resolutions of disapproval for ``midnight rules'', by a recorded vote of 238 ayes to 184 noes, Roll No. 8.<P/>Rejected the Castor (FL) motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on the Judiciary with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 183 yeas to 236 nays, Roll No. 7.

CONCURRENT RESOLUTION ON THE BUDGET, FISCAL YEAR 2017--MOTION TO PROCEED

extension.searchTitle: CONCURRENT RESOLUTION ON THE BUDGET, FISCAL YEAR 2017--MOTION TO PROCEED; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 2

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate began consideration of S. Con. Res. 3, setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2017 and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2018 through 2026.<P/>During consideration of this measure today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 51 yeas to 48 nays (Vote No. 1), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to consideration of the concurrent resolution.
